title: Rușii Anunță Lansarea Unui Laptop Nou, Specialiștii Susțin Că Cipurile Sunt Vechi De Un Deceniu
cleaned_sentences: The Bitan BM15 BITBLAZE notebook is manufactured by promotion, a Russian producer of storage systems and servers.
The company was founded in 2009 and has headquarters in WHO and Moscow.
"A chip in the Baikal M series is installed as a Bitblase processor.
It uses Cortex-A57 ARM Nuclei in 2012," notes Futurezone, which emphasizes that the central processing unit is equipped with 10 years old chips from the Taiwanese manufacturer TSMC.
Due to the war of aggression triggered on Ukraine, Taiwanese no longer produce chips for Russian companies, which is why promoted must resort to existing stocks.
Commercial Director: "works excellent" According to Iana Brîș, promoting commercial director, Bitblaze is fast enough for office work or watching youtube videos, although its hardware is not last.
"Good performances, thin aluminum housing, low weight.
We tested the main user applications: office programs and viewing on YouTube.
The battery lasts up to 5 hours.
We continue the test, preparing the official launch," Iana Brîș said on her page on the Russian social network.
Will cost almost 1,600 euros In the next few months the production of the Russian laptop should begin.
The first lot will contain about 1,000 pieces.
The price for this device is 100,000 rubles, around 1,590 euros, a price that can be inaccessible to average Russia citizens.
